# NSAccessibilityButton

**Protocol**

A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a button.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSAccessibilityButton : NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
```

## Overview

Use this protocol when you want a user interface element to behave like a button—a control that triggers an action when the user clicks it—in the accessibility hierarchy.

You can further enhance the adopting element by implementing any of the information properties or action methods that the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol declares.



## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the button.
- **accessibilityPerformPress()**: Simulates clicking the button.

## Buttons

- **NSAccessibilityRadioButton**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a radio button.
- **NSAccessibilitySwitch**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a switch.
- **NSAccessibilityCheckBox**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a checkbox.

## Inherits From

- NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
- NSObjectProtocol

## Inherited By

- NSAccessibilityCheckBox
- NSAccessibilityRadioButton
- NSAccessibilitySwitch

## Conforming Types

- NSButton
- NSPopUpButton
- NSStatusBarButton
- NSSwitch
